[She]2824-a fantastically gifted storyteller bolsters every story with emotional power , humor , and heart . Ideal for [all romance readers]2828-all romance readers . This book is for [Jenn Gaffney]130-jenn gaffney , who has encouraged [me]0-i from the very beginning . [Book bloggers]302-book bloggers are priceless champions . Thank [you]295-you !

ONE [BROOKLYN]8-brooklyn , [NEW YORK]1-new york APRIL 2016 The first time [Lauren Williams]141-lauren ever drank a shot of whiskey in front of [[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss was the night [the Brooklyn Bruisers]132-the bruisers clinched a play - offs berth for the first time since [Nate Kattenberger]133-nate bought [the team]304-the team . [It]305-it was ten o’clock , and the game against [Pittsburgh]9-pittsburgh had just rolled into its first overtime period . [The dozen or so people in [[Nate]133-nate ’s private box]307-nate ’s private box]306-the dozen or so people in nate ’s private box were tense , leaning forward in [their]306-the dozen or so people in nate ’s private box plush seats , waiting to learn what fate had in store for [the franchise]308-the franchise . [The pundits]309-the pundits had said it could n’t be done — that [a young team with [a new coach]311-a new coach]310-a young team with a new coach could n’t coalesce to advance into the postseason . [Freaking pundits]312-freaking pundits . A lifetime of hockey upsets had taught [Lauren]141-lauren not to trust [them]312-freaking pundits . Still , when [[team]313-team captain [Patrick O’Doul]134-o’doul]314-team captain patrick o’doul buried a slap shot in the corner of the net , securing [their]312-freaking pundits victory , [her]141-lauren breath caught in [her]141-lauren throat . No , gasped [her]141-lauren poor , bruised heart . “ YES ! ”[315-the fans] shrieked [the fans]315-the fans . That ’s when [Lauren]141-lauren walked straight over to the bar at the side of [[the team owner]316-the team owner ’s private box]317-the team owner ’s private box and poured [herself]141-lauren two fingers of Scotch , neat . Lifting it , [Lauren]141-lauren drained [her]141-lauren shot . Not that [anyone]318-anyone noticed [her]141-lauren sudden affinity for whiskey . [The rest of [the VIPs in [the room]321-the room]320-the vips in the room]319-the rest of the vips in the room rushed over to congratulate [[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss . It was a big moment for [the young billionaire who owned [the team]304-the team]323-the young billionaire who owned the team . A great moment . And somewhere deep inside in [her]141-lauren creaky soul [Lauren]141-lauren was happy for [him]323-the young billionaire who owned the team . But this was a disaster for [her]141-lauren . [Lauren]141-lauren forced [herself]141-lauren to walk over and look down at [the rink where [the players]326-the players were celebrating [their]326-the players victory]325-the rink where the players were celebrating their victory . [They]326-the players ’d convened into a knot of purple jerseys , rubbing helmets and slapping asses in the way of [victorious athletes]327-victorious athletes everywhere . There had been a time when [this team]328-this team had been [Lauren]141-lauren ’s whole life . Until the sudden , awful moment when it was n’t anymore . Somewhere in [that clot of [players down below]330-players down below]329-that clot of players down below was [the one who ’d turned [her]141-lauren entire world]331-the one who ’d turned her entire world upside down . Not only had [he]331-the one who ’d turned her entire world broken [her]141-lauren heart , but [he]331-the one who ’d turned her entire world ’d made it impossible for [her]141-lauren to feel comfortable in [the organization to which [she]141-lauren ’d devoted more than a decade of [her]141-lauren life]332-the organization to which she ’d devoted more than a decade of her life . For the past two years , [she]141-lauren ’d avoided [this team]328-this team , [this rink]334-this rink , and everything to do with hockey . [She]141-lauren ’d avoided [the entire borough of [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn]335-the entire borough of brooklyn , except when [[[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss ’s business]337-her boss ’s business brought [the two of [them]338-the two of them]338-the two of them over [the bridge]339-the bridge for a meeting . And the moment [she]141-lauren was free to go , [Lauren]141-lauren always hightailed it back to [[Manhattan]10-manhattan where [she]141-lauren belonged]340-manhattan where she belonged . But not this month . A week ago , [Nate]133-nate had asked [her]141-lauren to manage [[the hockey team]341-the hockey team ’s office]342-the hockey team ’s office for the balance of the season . [The young woman who usually did that job]343-the young woman who usually did that job had suffered a concussion , and [he]133-nate needed [someone capable to step in]344-someone capable to step in . Since [Lauren]141-lauren used to do precisely that job for [the team]304-the team before [the franchise]308-the franchise moved to [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn , [she]141-lauren was the obvious choice . Unfortunately . And if [the Bruisers]132-the bruisers had n’t made it to the play - offs , [she]141-lauren would have been finished with [them]304-the team by next week . However . The Scotch in [Lauren]141-lauren ’s belly fired [her]141-lauren courage , and [she]141-lauren glanced down at the ice again . The play - offs were composed of four seven - game series , each taking more than two weeks . The Stanley Cup would n’t be decided for two months . There was no telling how far [the team]304-the team would go . So [Lauren]141-lauren would have to spend at least a couple more weeks traveling with [the very people [she]141-lauren ’d worked so hard to avoid]348-the very people she ’d worked so hard to avoid . And there was no way out of it , unless [she]141-lauren wanted to quit [her]141-lauren job . And that was n’t happening . The next sound [she]141-lauren heard was the pop of a cork . “ Did it ! ”[211-becca] cried [Rebecca Rowley]211-becca , [the woman who was supposed to be running [the Bruisers ’ Brooklyn office]350-the bruisers ’ brooklyn office]349-the woman who was supposed to be running the bruisers ’ brooklyn office . [She]211-becca held a magnum of Cristal in two hands , which [she]211-becca now levered toward the first of a row of champagne flutes . [Lauren]141-lauren ’s eyes narrowed at this display of joy . [Miss Perky]136-miss perky was supposedly recovering from a rather serious head injury [she]136-miss perky ’d sustained by walking out onto [the ice rink]351-the ice rink in [her]136-miss perky street shoes . What had seemed like a minor fall had resulted in terrible symptoms for [the poor fool]352-the poor fool . [She]136-miss perky ’d been absent from work for a week already , and was therefore the cause of [Lauren]141-lauren ’s sudden craving for Scotch whiskey . But now [Becca]211-becca passed around glasses as if nothing in [the world]353-the world were wrong with [her]211-becca . [She]211-becca poured another glass as [[her]211-becca friend]354-her friend [Georgia]137-georgia — [one of [the team publicists]356-the team publicists]355-one of the team publicists — skated into [the room]321-the room with a grin on [her]137-georgia face . “ Press conference in ten minutes [guys]2830-guys . Oh ! Champagne . ”[137-georgia] “ Have some . ”[211-becca] [Becca]211-becca handed [Georgia]137-georgia a glass , then moved on to [[their]358-their boss]359-their boss , who gave [her]137-georgia a hundred watt smile . “ [I]211-becca ’m so happy for [you]360-the billionaire , ”[211-becca] [Becca]211-becca crowed , stretching [her]211-becca arms around [the billionaire]360-the billionaire and giving [him]360-the billionaire a big friendly squeeze . [Nate]133-nate looked a little stunned by the full - frontal embrace . As usual , [he]133-nate did a poor job of concealing [his]133-nate reaction to [Rebecca]211-becca . [His]133-nate arms did what [they]358-their probably always wanted to do , and closed around [her]211-becca back . [His]133-nate eyes fell shut , too . [Lauren]141-lauren had to look away . The yearning just rose off [Nate]133-nate like a mist . Hell — hugging [Rebecca]211-becca might be as exciting to [Nate]133-nate as the hockey victory itself . [Rebecca]211-becca pulled back a moment later , as oblivious to [him]133-nate as [she]211-becca always was . [She]211-becca grabbed another glass of champagne off the table and held it out to [Lauren]141-lauren . “ Champagne ? [I]211-becca know [you]141-lauren are n’t really [a drinker]2831-a drinker but . . . ”[211-becca] [Lauren]141-lauren took the glass from [Miss Perky]136-miss perky and took a gulp immediately . “ Thanks . ”[136-miss perky] “ [You]141-lauren ’re . . . welcome , ”[211-becca] [Becca]211-becca said , [her]211-becca eyes full of surprise . Then [she]211-becca scooped up two more glasses and moved off to serve [someone else]361-someone else , [her]211-becca hips swaying to the victory music that was playing in the stadium—“No Sleep Till [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn ”[211-becca] by [the Beastie Boys]138-the beastie boys . [Lauren]141-lauren checked [[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss ’s face , and found [his]303-her boss gaze tracking [Becca]211-becca across [the walnut - paneled room]363-the walnut - paneled room . [Lauren]141-lauren had been witness to this little romantic farce for the past two years . It was like living in a sitcom that [she]141-lauren could never shut off . And yet , if [Nate]133-nate ’s pining for [Becca]211-becca were the most irritating thing about [Lauren]141-lauren ’s situation at work , [she]141-lauren would n’t be drinking tonight . [Her]141-lauren problem was n’t with the work [she]141-lauren ’d be doing these next few weeks . Before [Nate Kattenberger]133-nate bought and rebranded the [Long Island]364-long island team , [she]141-lauren ’d spent ten years working in [the Syosset offices]365-the syosset offices . [It]366-it had been [Lauren]141-lauren that managed [[the team]304-the team ’s office]368-the team ’s office during its last three play - offs runs . Heck , [Lauren]141-lauren was [the veteran]369-the veteran and [Becca]211-becca was [the rookie]370-the rookie . But then , two years ago , [the young Internet whiz]371-the young internet whiz made a lot of changes to [the organization]372-the organization . [Lauren]141-lauren expected to be fired along with [the rest of [the casualties]374-the casualties]373-the rest of the casualties . In fact , [[her]141-lauren father]375-her father — [[the team]304-the team ’s general manager]377-the team ’s general manager — was [the first person [Nate]133-nate axed after the purchase went through]378-the first person nate axed after the purchase went through . [Lauren]141-lauren was n’t fired , though . On the contrary , when [Nate]133-nate moved [the team]304-the team to [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn , [he]133-nate stunned [her]141-lauren by moving [her]141-lauren even further — whisking [her]141-lauren into [the corporate headquarters of [[his]133-nate Internet company]381-his internet company in [Manhattan]10-manhattan]380-the corporate headquarters of his internet company in manhattan . [She]141-lauren ’d been ecstatic about this promotion , since working for [[Nate]133-nate ’s [Fortune 500 company]383-fortune 500 company]382-nate ’s fortune 500 company was exactly the sort of corporate leap [she]141-lauren ’d always hoped to make . Not only that , but the move away from [the hockey team]341-the hockey team solved a lot of problems for [Lauren]141-lauren all in one fell swoop , including the one huge problem that had suddenly knocked [her]141-lauren on [her]141-lauren ass . And that problem was down on the ice right now , draped in sweaty goalie pads , lining up to skate past [the other team]385-the other team for the traditional handshake . For the millionth time this week , [Lauren]141-lauren closed [her]141-lauren eyes and prayed to be spirited back to [[Nate]133-nate ’s office tower]386-nate ’s office tower where there were n’t [any hockey players]387-any hockey players , and there were n’t any reminders of [the man who ’d crushed [her]141-lauren spirit]388-the man who ’d crushed her spirit . But as long as [Becca]211-becca was unable to work , [Lauren]141-lauren was stuck in [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn . And now that [the Bruisers]132-the bruisers had won [their]389-their freaking play - offs slot , it meant a hailstorm of planning and administrative overtime . Four rounds , potentially . Two months . And travel . “ [Lauren]141-lauren . ”[133-nate] [Nate]133-nate ’s voice cut through [her]141-lauren reverie . “ Please call [Becca]211-becca [a car]2832-a car . [She]211-becca needs to get [home]2833-home and get some rest . ”[133-nate] “ Omigod , [I]211-becca ’m fine . ”[211-becca] [Rebecca]211-becca rolled [her]211-becca eyes . “ [I]211-becca can just walk , or grab [a cab]2834-a cab . And all [I]211-becca do is rest . ”[211-becca] But [Nate]133-nate gave [Lauren]141-lauren a look over [Becca]211-becca ’s head . And that look said , get [her]141-lauren [a car]2832-a car . “ No big deal , ”[141-lauren] [Lauren]141-lauren sighed , taking a healthy slug of [her]141-lauren champagne . “ [I]141-lauren have [drivers]2835-drivers waiting outside already . ”[141-lauren] [She]141-lauren ’d dealt with transportation during the third period of the game , while [everyone else]391-everyone else was screaming encouragements toward the ice . “ [You]133-nate should take”—she[141-lauren] pulled [her]141-lauren Katt Phone out of [her]141-lauren bag—“number 117 . [It]2832-a car ’s parked at the curb outside [the rink]2836-the rink door . ”[141-lauren] [Nate]133-nate gave [her]141-lauren a thankful nod . Then [he]133-nate went over to the coat rack in the corner and fetched [Becca]211-becca ’s leopard - print jacket . [He]133-nate eased it onto [her]211-becca shoulders until [Becca]211-becca set down [her]211-becca empty soda glass and shoved [her]211-becca arms into the jacket , an irritated look on [her]211-becca face . “ Pushy , ”[211-becca] [she]211-becca muttered under [her]211-becca breath . Probably . “ Let ’s go , [Nate]133-nate ! ”[137-georgia] [Georgia]137-georgia said , clapping [her]137-georgia hands . “ [You]133-nate ca n’t be late for [your]133-nate own press conference . ”[137-georgia] [She]137-georgia grabbed [his]133-nate suit jacket off a chair and herded [him]133-nate toward the door . The fact that [[their]393-their fearless leader]394-their fearless leader was actually wearing a suit spoke of tonight ’s significance . [Nate]133-nate was [a jeans - hoodie - and-800 - dollar - sneakers kind of guy]395-a jeans - hoodie - and-800 - dollar - sneakers kind of guy , even on game night . [Lauren]141-lauren followed [[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss , [the publicist]397-the publicist , and [Rebecca]211-becca into [the private elevator]398-the private elevator , wondering why [she]141-lauren could n’t at least be happy for [Nate]133-nate . [He]133-nate ’d wanted this so badly . But all [Lauren]141-lauren felt was dread for the next few weeks . And a healthy dose of anger , too . Bitter much ? Why yes , [I]0-i still am . This was an unpleasant realization . Most of the time , [Lauren]141-lauren was able to stay away from both hockey and [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn . In [Manhattan]10-manhattan , [she]141-lauren was able to focus on [her]141-lauren excellent job , [[her]141-lauren tidy little Murray Hill neighborhood apartment]399-her tidy little murray hill neighborhood apartment and the college degree [she]141-lauren was just finishing up . [She]141-lauren was too damn busy to feel bitter . But as [the elevator]400-the elevator slid lower toward [the locker rooms]401-the locker rooms , so did [her]141-lauren stomach . TEN [BROOKLYN]8-brooklyn , [NEW YORK]1-new york APRIL 2016 The next morning at ten thirty , [Mike]143-mike keyed in the security code on the door of [[his]143-mike brownstone]1166-his brownstone and walked inside . [He]143-mike just stood there in the entryway to [[his]143-mike own home]1168-his own home for several minutes , listening until the piece broke down . “ [You]143-mike said to repeat ! ”[151-elsa] [Elsa]151-elsa said with a giggle . “ But not there ! ”[155-hans] [Hans]155-hans argued , [his]155-hans voice amused . “ Go back to measure fifty - five . Let ’s finish this before [I]155-hans ’m old . ”[155-hans] The music started up again , and [he]143-mike walked slowly through [the house]572-the house . [The Wall Street couple who ’d sold [it]1170-this place to [him]143-mike]1171-the wall street couple who ’d sold it to him had done a modern renovation down to the studs . [It]1170-this place was ridiculously contemporary , though , with every surface painted either a shimmering white or an expensive shade of dove gray . The light fixtures resembled space age bird ’s nests . Or something . [He]143-mike could n’t quite decide what the hell [they]1174-they were supposed to be . [He]143-mike ’d probably been [a dream client]1178-a dream client — checkbook open and no patience to sweat the details . [Mike]143-mike was still smiling as [he]143-mike climbed the stairs toward [[Elsa]151-elsa ’s room]1179-elsa ’s room . The violins got louder . [Elsa]151-elsa had taken to [him]155-hans immediately , and [he]155-hans ’d been [[her]151-elsa teacher]1185-her teacher for years . ELEVEN BAL [HARBOUR]52-harbour , [FLORIDA]53-florida APRIL 2016 [Lauren]141-lauren flew to [Florida]53-florida with an extra suitcase full of dresses and accessories . Not only had [she]141-lauren promised [Ari]180-ari some wardrobe assistance , but [she]141-lauren was having a fashion crisis of [her]141-lauren own , too . Waiting at [the baggage claim]1233-the baggage claim , [she]141-lauren felt eyes on [her]141-lauren back . When [she]141-lauren turned around , [Mike Beacon]143-mike was watching [her]141-lauren from across [the room]321-the room . Damn it . That was not what [she]141-lauren needed . When [she]141-lauren pulled [her]141-lauren two suitcases off the carousel at the same time , a hand reached out to help [her]141-lauren with one of them . [She]141-lauren stiffened , but it was only [Jimbo]161-jimbo , [the youngest member of the travel team]1235-the youngest member of the travel team . “ Is that all of [your]141-lauren bags , [Miss Lauren]141-lauren ? ”[161-jimbo] [he]161-jimbo asked politely . “ That ’s all . Thank [you]141-lauren . ”[161-jimbo] “ [I]161-jimbo ’ll grab this one , ”[161-jimbo] [he]161-jimbo said helpfully , adding one of [her]141-lauren bags to the rolling trolley [he]161-jimbo was assembling . “ Thanks , ”[141-lauren] [she]141-lauren said again , pulling the other one after [her]141-lauren toward the door . [She]141-lauren walked right past [Mike]143-mike , feeling [his]143-mike eyes following [her]141-lauren out the door and into the [Florida]53-florida sunshine toward [the bus]2892-the bus . Hell , [they]1237-they were still at [the airport]2903-the airport and [she]141-lauren already felt butterflies in [her]141-lauren stomach . This party made [her]141-lauren nervous . Really nervous . Not only would [Mike]143-mike be [there]445-there , but [the Atlantic coast of [Florida]53-florida]1240-the atlantic coast of florida had way too much history for [her]141-lauren . There was no way to feel the sunshine on [her]141-lauren face and ignore the ghosts of [her]141-lauren own happiness swirling around [her]141-lauren . SEVENTEEN Six hours later , [Beacon]143-mike had only one thing on [his]143-mike mind : a black , six - ounce rubber disc . EIGHTEEN [BROOKLYN]8-brooklyn , [NEW YORK]1-new york MAY 2016 When [Lauren]141-lauren got back to [Brooklyn]8-brooklyn , the first thing [she]141-lauren did was to push back [Nate]133-nate ’s China trip into late June . [Her]141-lauren old hockey - watching habits had kicked in hard , and [she]141-lauren had a gut feeling [the Brooklyn team]1687-the brooklyn team would win this series and advance to the Eastern Conference Final . And , weirdly , [she]141-lauren was n’t sure [she]141-lauren minded . Maybe [she]141-lauren would n’t admit it aloud , but it was fun watching [[her]141-lauren boys]1688-her boys win again . [She]141-lauren ’d caught [herself]141-lauren thinking of [them]1688-her boys as [[her]141-lauren boys]1688-her boys again , just like in the old days . For the past two years it had hurt too much to think of [the team]304-the team that way . But lately [she]141-lauren felt more relaxed in [[their]1688-her boys company]1691-their company . [She]141-lauren sounded like [the Lauren of years past]1695-the lauren of years past — the one who teased [the players]326-the players instead of snapping at [them]326-the players . “ But if [you]143-mike do n’t show up to the right press conference after the game tonight , [you]143-mike ’ll have to answer to [Georgia]137-georgia and [Tommy]140-tommy . ”[141-lauren] [She]141-lauren even gave [Mike]143-mike a smile as [she]141-lauren handed [him]143-mike a copy . [The players]326-the players had spent the morning with [the coaching coordinators]1698-the coaching coordinators or with [Ari]180-ari , [the massage therapist]1699-the massage therapist . [The Brooklyn HQ]73-the brooklyn hq had the feel of a war bunker this week . It was all hands on deck . Meals were catered into [the lounge]1700-the lounge so that [nobody]2850-nobody had to leave . [The publicity office]1511-the publicity office was overrun with calls , which meant [support staff of all stripes]1703-support staff of all stripes were pitching in . There was plenty of chatter about the incident in [Tampa]54-tampa . [The league]2847-the league had fined [Skews]235-skews for [his]235-skews comments , and [the player]1708-the player had issued a stuttering apology , asking for forgiveness from whoever [he]235-skews ’d offended . Twitter lit up with commentary . Much of it was supportive of the sanctions against [Skews]235-skews , but there was a lot of ugliness among [hockey fans complaining about “ PC bullshit ”[1709-hockey fans complaining about “ pc bullshit ” and favoritism] and favoritism]1709-hockey fans complaining about “ pc bullshit ” and favoritism . [She]141-lauren forwarded the link to [Georgia]137-georgia , then just sat there at [her]141-lauren desk , stewing over it . [Georgia]137-georgia ’s reply was swift . [I]0-i saw it . At six o’clock , [Lauren]141-lauren accompanied [[her]141-lauren boss]303-her boss to [the arena]1719-the arena . [She]141-lauren did n’t avoid [the place]427-the place anymore , but watching the action would be stressful for brand - new reasons . When the game began , it was a brutal one right from the first face - off . [Both teams]1058-both teams skated as if [they]1058-both teams had something to prove . And [they]1058-both teams did . [Lauren]141-lauren found [herself]141-lauren unaccountably nervous . Maybe it ’s the hormones , [she]141-lauren told [herself]141-lauren . The medication [she]141-lauren ’d just started taking was probably to blame for the nervous stirring in [her]141-lauren stomach . Standing in [[Nate]133-nate ’s box]1722-nate ’s box , watching [the boys]1723-the boys fly down the ice , it was hard to remember that [she]141-lauren was n’t supposed to care about [this team]328-this team anymore . For more than a decade of [her]141-lauren life [she]141-lauren ’d watched fifty games a year . And well before [she]141-lauren and [Mike]143-mike were ever [a couple]599-a couple , [her]141-lauren eyes used to always come to rest on [the goalie]434-the goalie . [She]141-lauren knew [his]133-nate stance so well [she]141-lauren could draw [him]133-nate with [her]141-lauren eyes closed . [His]133-nate long limbs were loose , waiting to spring into action . TWENTY - FOUR The following night , in a burst of optimism , [Lauren]141-lauren went to watch [Mike]143-mike try to shut out [Detroit]45-detroit in game four . [She]141-lauren did n’t need a ticket . Overtime periods were n’t like regular periods , though — they were played with the sudden death rule . A goal ended the game . So one moment [Lauren]141-lauren was watching [Trevi]175-leo try to get the puck away from [[his]175-leo opponent]1756-his opponent , who passed it behind [his]175-leo body . Then the puck flew right past [his]143-mike right shoulder and into the net . Before [she]141-lauren could had even make sense of the play , the game was over . [Mike]143-mike collapsed in frustration onto the ice , [his]143-mike head in [his]143-mike hands . And [fifteen thousand Brooklyn fans]2201-fifteen thousand brooklyn fans made noises of frustration . That was it . Time to hit the showers , [boys]3064-boys . Nothing more to be done tonight . Depressed , [Lauren]141-lauren made [her]141-lauren way [downstairs]2999-downstairs , as if by habit . [She]141-lauren broke off a bite of bread and buttered it . [She]141-lauren put it in [her]141-lauren mouth and chewed . [She]141-lauren made it just in time , slamming the little door and sliding the lock which activated the lights . [Lauren]141-lauren wiped [her]141-lauren mouth on a paper towel and tried to think . [Her]141-lauren pregnancy book had warned that nausea often hit during week six , or four weeks after conception .
